attributes.action: set up a National Investment Bank to lend to industry and individuals, bypassing banks who are failing the economy and their duty to lend
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
“We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to set up a taxpayer sponsored National Investment Bank, with sole remit to provide commercial loans to industry and individuals, promoting investment and spending, bypassing retail lenders who are unable to lend."

With interest rates falling towards zero, the next key step is to increase the quantity of lending in the economy, to promote investment and spending.

Retail banks are failing in their duty to lend, despite significant taxpayer funding.  Now is the time to move swiftly forward to set up this NIB to directly promote investment and spending to halt the spiral of recession.

This bank, established by the government and lending on commercial terms, would be based out of:

1.  Branches of the Government owned Royal Bank of Scotland, National Westminster Bank and Northern Rock

2.  The GPO and

3.  Newly established branches.

This initiative moves beyond recently introduced liquidity measures, US TARP and interest rate cuts to actually place the quantitative liquidity precisely where it is needed to halt the accelerating decline in the economy.

We beseech the PM to announce this measure before Christmas.
